name: 5-(2,5-dichlorophenyl)-3-(thiophen-2-ylcarbonyl)-3aH-pyrrolo[3,4-d]isoxazole-4,6(5H,6aH)-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2203
Reason: 5-(2,5-dichlorophenyl)-3-(thiophen-2-ylcarbonyl)-3aH-pyrrolo[3,4-d]isoxazole-4,6(5H,6aH)-dione has a complex structure with multiple functional groups. The basic unit for comparison is 3aH-pyrrolo[3,4-d]isoxazole-4,6(5H,6aH)-dione, which has a melting point of 106 degrees Celsius. The presence of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion and a thiophene ring linked in a linear fashion would significantly augment the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. The thiophene ring also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and increase molecular weight. The presence of two additional phenyl groups and one thiophenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
